intro: Chrysanthemum auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to yellow, are often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Chrysanthemum auriculatum is also cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
